column4: Okay, let's try another one.  I have largely eschewed Gnome for Openbox 3 only; but I want to add to my menu stuff like firestarter or ethereal, that require sudo.
What can I do to make the password dialog box pop up, so I don't have to always have a terminal tethered to a process/application running?
oh...I saw this yesterday :)
it was something like 'detach' or something..can't remember
Hmmm...
what app are you running?
firestarter and ethereal require it.
try running with gksudo?
Aha!  That might actually be it!
the syntax for the thing was something like   <command you want to use> & detach
but it might not be 'detach'...I'm obsessed now..I have to find it :)
ah it is 'detach' :)
gksudo is precisely what I want.
well thats the main thing :D
But now the detach thing is interesting.  I can open a terminal, type "sudo firestarter & detach", type password, and all is good?
I think so :)
I think strictly speaking gtk apps are supposed to be run with gksudo
the ones that need to be run as a superuser that is
Makes sense.
Tried the "sudo <command> & detach" at the command line, but no go.  It's no big deal, but now I'm curious.  Do you have "screen" installed by chance?  I know it lets you detach processes.
yeah...its installed but I don't know how to use it
I think that's a screen-specific command.
